name: Guinness Storehouse
description: Brewery experience telling the tale of Ireland's famous beer, with tastings and a rooftop bar.

name: Temple Bar
description: Temple Bar is a busy riverside neighbourhood, spread over cobbled pedestrian lanes. Crowded pubs host live folk music and DJ sets, and diners pack restaurants serving Asian, American and Irish cuisine. Quirky boutiques stock clothes and crafts by local designers. The National Photographic Archive highlights Irelandâ€™s past, while the Project Arts Centre and Temple Bar Gallery + Studios shows contemporary art.
short_description: Live music & the Project Arts Centre

name: Dublin Castle
description: Historic site, dating from 1204, with 2 museums, cafes and gardens, plus state rooms and a library.
short_description: Museums, state rooms & a Gothic chapel

name: Phoenix Park
description: Deer roam forested areas filled with mature trees within this area known as 'Dublin's playground'.
short_description: Enormous green space housing Dublin Zoo

name: Saint Stephen's Green
description: City centre park with ornamental lake, waterfall, sculptures and a children's playground.

name: Kilmainham Gaol
description: Prison museum where many of Ireland's political prisoners were incarcerated, tortured and executed.
short_description: Prison telling stories of Ireland's past

name: Christ Church Cathedral
description: Medieval place of CofI worship with a mummified rat & cat plus a cafe & gift shop in the crypt.
short_description: Medieval edifice with a crypt & cafe

name: St Patrick's Cathedral
description: The Church of Ireland's national cathedral, dating from 1220, with lunchtime musical recitals.

name: Dublin Zoo
description: The largest zoo in Ireland has African Plain, Fringes of the Arctic and Asian Forests exhibits.

name: Jameson Distillery Bow St
description: Expert guides tell the story of Jameson in a recreated distillery scene with tastings and dining.
short_description: Tours of the famous whiskey distillery

name: Malahide Castle & Gardens
description: Towered stone bulwark holding antique furnishings and portraits, plus a huge garden and restaurant.

name: Ha'penny Bridge
description: Refurbished 19th-century cast-iron span & city symbol, crossed by thousands of pedestrians daily.

name: Powerscourt
description: 18th-century stately home and famous landscaped grounds, with themed gardens and a 398-ft. waterfall in mountain foothill area with ancient trees, sika deer & rich birdlife.

name: Trinity College Library
description: It is a legal deposit or 'copyright library', which means that publishers in Ireland must deposit a copy of all their publications there, free of charge.
short_description: The Library of Trinity College Dublin serves Trinity College and the University of Dublin.

name: National Botanic Gardens
description: Large area with naturalistic sections, formal gardens, an arboretum and a Victorian palm house.

name: The Spire
description: This towering cone-shaped monument is known for its minimalist elegance & reflective steel surface.

name: National Gallery of Ireland
description: Grand collection of European art spanning the 14th to the 20th-century covering all major schools.

name: Chester Beatty
description: Mining magnate's exceptional collections of religious and artistic work on grounds of Dublin Castle.

name: Merrion Square South
description: Merrion Square is a Georgian garden square on the southside of Dublin city centre.
short_description: Art museum, monument, park, and history

name: The Little Museum of Dublin
description: Museum chronicling remarkable changes to the lifestyles of Dubliners over the the last century.

name: National Museum of Ireland
description: The National Museum of Ireland is Ireland's leading museum institution, with a strong emphasis on national and some international archaeology, Irish history, Irish art, culture, and natural history.

name: Irish Museum of Modern Art
description: Imposing building from 1684 housing permanent collection and temporary exhibitions of varied art.

name: Glasnevin Cemetery
description: Victorian burial grounds & museum with guided tours, interactive exhibits, a gift shop & cafe.

name: An Post, General Post Office
description: Historical accounts and effects outlining the role of the Irish post service in the country's past.
short_description: Compact museum of the post office

name: Dublin Writers Museum
description: Letters, books and artifacts covering 300 years of Dublin's acclaimed literary heritage.

name: Viking Splash Tours
description: Discover all Dublin has to offer! See Dublin's tallest Cathedral, unearth stories about our old medieval city and Viking heritage, spot Dublin's iconic skyline feature, the Spire, all before splashing into the Grand Canal Basin to uncover U2's recording studios.

name: Molly Malone Statue
description: Bronze statue of a fictional fishmonger named Molly Malone, the star of a well-known Irish song.
short_description: Statue based on a popular Irish song

name: Aviva Stadium
description: Large stadium with an unusual glass end used for international sports and occasional concerts.

name: National Leprechaun Museum of Ireland
description: Family-friendly museum with interactive exhibits telling stories about Ireland's mythical creatures.

name: The Custom House
description: Neoclassical building used as a government office, designed by James Gandon and completed in 1791.

name: Dublin Bay
description: Dublin Bay is a C-shaped inlet of the Irish Sea on the east coast of Ireland. The bay is about 10 kilometres wide along its north-south base, and 7 km in length to its apex at the centre of the city of Dublin; stretching from Howth Head in the north to Dalkey Point in the south.

name: The National Wax Museum Plus
description: Family museum containing hundreds of wax versions of famous Irish and international personalities.

name: Dublinia
description: Sights and smells bring hundreds of year's worth of history to life at this child friendly museum.

name: EPIC The Irish Emigration Museum
description: EPIC The Irish Emigration Museum is a museum located in Dublin's Docklands which covers the history of the Irish diaspora and emigration to other countries. It was voted as 'Europe's Leading Tourist Attraction' at the World Travel Awards in 2019.

name: The Book of Kells
description: Grand library location for illuminated illustrations of the Christian Gospels dating from 800AD.

name: Dublin City Gallery - The Hugh Lane
description: Gallery containing the reconstructed studio of Francis Bacon and a strong collection of French work.

name: Farmleigh House
description: Restored, 18th-century state guest house on 78 acres, with gardens, guided tours & a boathouse cafe.

name: Irish Whiskey Museum
description: Guided tours tracing the history of whiskey through interactive exhibits, plus a tasting at the end.

name: Jeanie Johnston Tall Ship
description: Tours below and above deck of a replica, 19th-century ship that took Irish emigrants to America.

name: O'Connell Bridge
description: O'Connell Bridge is a road bridge spanning the River Liffey in Dublin, and joining O'Connell Street to D'Olier Street, Westmoreland Street and the south quays.

name: National Library of Ireland
description: Non-lending library housing the personal notes of Roddy Doyle, Seamus Heaney and James Joyce.

name: Killiney Hill
description: Popular walking & hiking locale with panoramic ocean & mountain views, plus a park with monuments.
short_description: Hiking spot with sea & mountain views

name: Howth Castle
description: Centuries-old property hosting public tours, cooking classes & afternoon tea in a garden cafe.
short_description: Medieval-era site with tours & a cafe

name: Iveagh Gardens
description: Unique collection of garden landscapes designed in 1865 and mostly restored since 1995.
